description: From auf, Old Norse álfr (“elf”) (whence Norwegian Bokmål alv). Doublet of elf.

entries.meaning: (derogatory) A person, especially a large male, who is clumsy or a simpleton.
examples: Ouch! You dropped that box on my feet, you lumbering oaf!

entries.meaning: (obsolete) An elf's child; a changeling left by fairies or goblins, hence, a deformed or foolish child.
